meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I just played through The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame, and I'm still trying to figure out what the developers were thinking. It's like they took all the fun, creativity, and charm of the original LEGO games and replaced it with a bland, uninspired cash grab.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "But [Your Name], what about COGconnected? They gave it a score of 20!" Yeah, okay, COGconnected, you're harshing my mellow. I mean, I get it, game development is hard, but come on! This feels like a rushed job, like they phoned it in and just hoped no one would notice.

And don't even get me started on Eurogamer Italy's review - "it looks like a LEGO World reskin"?! That's not a criticism, that's a compliment! The original LEGO games were all about building and exploring, and this game does just that. But I guess when you're trying to cash in on a popular movie franchise, you gotta try harder.

But wait, it gets worse! Metro GameCentral says it's "a cheap and nasty film tie-in"?! That's harsh, man. I mean, I've played some bad games before, but this one takes the cake (or should I say, the LEGO brick?).

On the bright side, 3DJuegos seems to think it's got some interesting sandbox gameplay mechanics. And Meristation says it's perfect for kids! So if you're looking for a game to entertain your tiny humans, The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame might be the way to go.

But let's not forget Cubed3's review - "everything is just meh". Ouch, that hurts. I mean, who wants to play a game that's just...meh? It's like playing with blocks without the fun of actually building something cool.

So, what's my verdict? Well, I won't leave you hanging - it's not all bad! The graphics are nice, and the characters are cute (even if they do look like they came straight from a LEGO World reskin). But overall, this game is just...meh. It's a missed opportunity to create something special, something that would really capture the essence of the movie.

In conclusion, The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame is a bit of a letdown. It's not terrible, but it's not great either. If you're looking for a good LEGO game, I'd recommend checking out some of the other titles in the series - like DC Super-Villains or the re-release of Harry Potter games.

But hey, if you're looking for a game to play with your kids, The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame might be the way to go. Just don't expect too much from it, and you won't be disappointed.
